reviews.review_msg: She is passionate. Very difficult marker. I understand the reason to be because she cares about her students. She wants students to come out of her class being able to critically think about important issues rather than rehearsing what is taught.
Avoid at all costs. Very intimidating and seems to look for everything she can possibly pick apart or disagree with.  You must be able to read her mind to get a good grade.

She is the marker of this class.  Avoid her and stay clear of her . Unless your assignment reflects her views on the subject to a tee expect to fail hard. No  proper criteria or rubrics given.  Not open to any view which are not hers. Lots of reading and writing for a class which is not even W. She will pretty much rip you apart and leave you cryin

Run for your life with this one! She is an insanely hard marker... You may have spent a long time writing a coherent, insightful assignment but that will only get you 510,maybe a 5.510 if you're lucky. Lots of reading, lots of writing (even though it's not a W class), won't answer your questions. Run away, run away!
She's a very hard marker. Don't pick her courses.
DON'T TAKE HER COURSES. Other than being a tough marker, she is a mean and intimidating person.

I have never gotten less than a B- on an essay in my life. I got a D on the in class essay. I answered the question and provided a counter argument. And apparently I did that right but she expected more arguments and counter arguments for a 30-minute in class write. She is a super hard marker! In any other class it would have been at least a B.

I sat through every tutorial and learned nothing from her. Stay away from her class as much as possible. She expects all her students to be philosophers when she is not even a philosophy major herself. What's up with that?

Difficult. Does not seem to keep in mind that there are students who have never taken a philosophy class before, and marks them as experienced philosophy students. Does office hours over Skype for one hour once a week, not very accessible.
Prepare to also take FNST101 throughout her courses. Very biased. VERY. Will piss you off unless you like the D. So lazy you have to SKYPE her for office hours.
